programme.desc: The murder of a Hollywood stunt man leads investigators to a woman once married to a movie star mobster.

programme.title: Rory McIlroy Wins the AT&T Pebble Beach Pro-Am
programme.desc: Northern Irishman Rory McIlroy won his 2025 season debut with a 21-under 267 (66-70-65-66), good for a two-shot victory and his 27th on the PGA TOUR.

programme.title: Billy Horschel Wins Corales Puntacana
programme.desc: Billy Horschel captures his eighth career victory after winning the 2024 Corales Puntacana Championship. Horschel shot rounds of 67-69-66-63 to finish 23-under par and capture his first win since the 2022 Memorial Tournament presented by Workday.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Nearly 800 rebuys would take this field size to 1,334 and a prize pool of over $1.26 million. The final table would be stacked with tournament veterans led by Daniel Negreanu, John Juanda, Mike Matusow, Lee Markholt, Paul Phillips, and Ram Vaswani as all eyes were on the $365,900 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The 831-entrant field created a $1.14 million prize pool in the first $1,500 No-Limit Hold'em event of the 2004 WSOP. Poker author Blair Rodman, and tournament regulars Joe Awada, Scott Epstein, and Kent Washington held seats at the final table, along with "The Crew" member Scott Fischman as the $300,000 first-place prize was up for grabs.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The biggest No-Limit Hold'em buy-in of the 2004 WSOP outside of the Main Event would attract 254 entrants and create a prize pool of $1,193,800. Barry Greenstein and Dewey Tomko fell short of reaching the final table, as WSOP veterans James Sousa and Paul "Eskimo" Clark headlined the final table ahead of Lee Watkinson, Thomas Keller, Martin de Knijff, and Young Phan as they chased the $382,020 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The $1,000 Ladies Event attracted 201 entrants and would see the final table headlined by Karina Jett and Susie Isaacs as nine lucky ladies look to capture the WSOP bracelet and $58,530 first-place prize.

programme.desc: A Harlem con man pretends to be a preacher in order to steal money from the congregation. As conflicts develop, he seeks a way to redeem himself.

programme.title: When Girls Ride
programme.desc: Three friends start a women's biker club in a male-dominated world. Things take a turn when they lose one of their own and set out to get justice.

programme.title: Reality TV Murders
programme.desc: A cast member of a hit reality TV show is murdered, and her co-stars are all suspects.

programme.title: Just Can't Leave You Alone
programme.desc: When a blind date ends in a shootout, Krystal Gray is left with more questions than answers. She discovers a flash drive linked to the murder and a web of secrets involving her brother, a dirty cop, and a mysterious man named Jarrell.

programme.title: Game of Cards
programme.desc: When data analyst Nicole Tucker's car is broken into and a mysterious military-issued card tied to her family legacy is stolen, she's thrust into a dangerous game of betrayal.

programme.title: The Wait Game
programme.desc: Yolanda Hills, a woman deeply in love with her longtime partner Jonas Jones, has been patiently awaiting their wedding day. Their idyllic relationship takes a terrifying turn when a home intruder invades their peaceful sanctuary. Held captive in her own home, Yolanda is confronted with a shocking revelation that will forever alter the course of their lives.

programme.title: Curfew: Sins of the Father
programme.desc: Former police captain Thomas Cooper, once a respected figure, finds himself entangled in a dangerous deal with a notorious crime boss. His involvement leads to a love triangle and ultimately a betrayal. Now, haunted by his past, Thomas must confront the consequences when his son, Christian, becomes a target of the crime boss's revenge.

programme.title: Lines of Allegiance
programme.desc: After running a criminal enterprise for years, Professa feels it's time for a change. When he's set up by someone in his crew, he's arrested and sent out of Macon, GA per the judge's order. But when tragedy forces him to return, he finds the people he once cared for, have their own intentions for themselves.

programme.title: Reality TV Murders
programme.desc: A cast member of a hit reality TV show is murdered, and her co-stars are all suspects.

programme.title: The Forsaken
programme.desc: A young boy uncovers an old book about two inspiring cowboys and uses their tales in his own life.

programme.title: A Secret Lie in Love
programme.desc: A married couple’s ideal suburban life begins to unravel as greed and betrayal push their relationship to the brink.

programme.title: Her Best Revenge
programme.desc: After a tragic death, five fraternity bother reunite at a vacation home, while the shadow of a death from their past lingers over them. A mysterious figure begins to send them threatening messages.

programme.title: Rich Intent
programme.desc: 16-year-old Quana yearns to go to her very first concert. When she gets the opportunity to see her favorite artist, her dreams quickly spiral into a horrific nightmare of imprisonment and shady deals.

programme.title: Sinful Paradise: Welcome to Paradise
programme.desc: The owner of one of the only female-owned clubs in the city, Cat and her business partner SP protect their dynasty. Looking at the stories and obstacles of it's dancers.

programme.title: The Housekeeper
programme.desc: After the murder of her son, grief-stricken Sharease takes a job as a housekeeper and becomes a lover to a man she learns was a local crime boss.

programme.title: Meli
programme.desc: Forced to take desperate measures to save her family, a young woman robs a stranger's home, unknowingly targeting someone far more dangerous.

programme.title: The Drive
programme.desc: A doctor’s life is upended on a drive home from a conference as he learns of his daughter’s kidnapping at the hands of those in his inner circle.

programme.title: Rhythm and Revenge
programme.desc: After losing her parents, Journi, a talented but troubled teenager, moves in with her aunt and cousin for a fresh start. As she navigates the pressures of competitive dance, strange accidents begin to occur around her.

programme.title: The New Girl
programme.desc: When her sister Monica suddenly disappears under suspicious circumstances, Malorie becomes convinced that Monica's seemingly perfect husband is hiding something sinister.

programme.title: The House on Adams Drive
programme.desc: Sean is convinced the only way to keep the woman of his dreams happy is by obtaining as much money as possible. His friend Kordell, who's an adult film star, helps him with a way to make a lot of money overnight. When they're sent to a house to possibly film a scene, that turns out to be a real life exorcism.

programme.title: Thick Trip
programme.desc: Four close-knit friends, all single and yearning for a change, embark on a summer-long 'Queen's Trip' to South Padre, Houston, and the untouched wilderness. As they travel and experience the vibrant cultures and breathtaking landscapes, they confront their fears, rediscover their passions, and explore their own wild sides.

programme.title: The Lineup
programme.desc: Sebastian "Bas" Monte is an up-and-coming influencer and club promoter. He doesn't have the time to commit to only one woman, so he schedules out different women for his needs. That is until he meets Mikayla, and he questions his playboy ways.

programme.title: Under the Gun
programme.desc: Cam is a troubled street hustler battling addiction, grief, and mounting debt, as his recklessness threatens to dismantle the tight-knit crime family that raised him.

Since Kelly saved the life of Chief Gall (John Russell) years before, the chief promises to free him if Kelly treats wounded Arapaho maiden Wahleeah (Andra Martin). Soon Kelly and the recovered Wahleeah are caught between Towns' soldiers and the vengeful Sioux.

The men hide their treasure and fend off McCracken with the help of Doc Gates (Chill Wills), before escaping to recover at the ranch of Rainbolt's friend, Amos Gondora (Robert Middleton), waiting until they can retrieve the gold.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is called in to track down a new outlaw, the local sheriff who is a friend. The good sheriff who was seduced into robbing a bank by his girlfriend, convinces Josh to let him assist in her capture

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh takes a job protecting a deaf teenage girl and keeping everyone off the father's place for a day or two. Although initially bored, Josh starts to develop a relationship with the friendly girl.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh escorts a photographer to take a picture of his friend El Gato, who is a hilarious bandit living in the hills of Mexico with a small army. However, El Gato is new to photographs and leery.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A broke Josh is hired by a fearful man to help him elope with his sweetheart, Jane, the daughter of a local rancher. The girl's father is vehemently opposed to the marriage.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh takes a job protecting an express office employee who stole $10,000 and wants to return it before it's discovered missing. However, he had an accomplice and does not know where the accomplice is.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A Japanese woman travels to the U.S. to find a man who proposed to her and hires Josh to find him since no one will help her. Josh is confronted by the Japanese man to whom she had been promised.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh arrives in town thinking the sheriff summoned him to go after a man. Instead, a woman wants Josh to bring in the man, her wanted husband, alive, so he can prove self defense.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh rides to Barney Durant's horse business right after Barney pushes his son to leave. When Josh's prisoners escape taking 2 horses from his horse trader friend, he helps in tracking them down.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is summoned for help when the Pinto bank is robbed.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh expects a bounty for bringing in Daniel Trenner but his prisoner is stolen by the sheriff. Ex-army personnel want to stage an illegal trial accusing their former lieutenant of dereliction of duty

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is hired by a woman to sober up Harry, a drunk who is also Josh's friend. She learned his wealthy brother who Harry hasn't seen in years is coming to visit so she wants Harry to be presentable.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh and the beautiful prisoner he is transporting are on a three day trip while her partner is still on the loose. For once Josh may not follow through on obeying the law as they fall in love.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is on his way to River City to transport three convicts there to be hanged. The dangerous prisoners escape and appoint themselves the law, after the town is hit by a tornado, killing the sheriff.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A journalist accompanies Josh on his manhunt to get an exclusive story on a bounty hunter. Josh agrees to let him join him in the hunt for Jack Torrance but finds they have different methods.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh feels compelled to repay a debt to an old friend who's in jail and may hang. However, the friend escapes, forcing Josh to go on the hunt for him until it appears he died when he went over a cliff

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh brings in outlaw Carlos Domingo, but he has to be released when the witness against him is killed. Josh concocts a surprise witness to testify against the notorious killer - his own mother.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is sent for by the desperate men of Coronado. He is hired to convince the women of the town to come back to their men when they leave demanding that all towns men give up their guns for good.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh brings in a man wanted for robbery but loses his reward. A well meaning doctor pays an innocent man to take the blame for his son, but the son sets out to kill the man to make sure he never tells

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh arrives in a town for rest just as the local bank has been robbed. A traveling medicine man knows the whereabouts of the suspect and wants Josh to help because he thinks the suspect is innocent.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A widow wants to hire/propose to Josh so she doesn't lose custody of her son. Josh served under her husband in the war. His mother now is trying to steal her grandson to take over the family fortune.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A woman asks Josh, an old friend, to help find her husband Frank - a bounty hunter out to settle a score. He wants to catch a young outlaw who shot him in the leg.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: When Randall has a sheriff bed a prisoner, the man's gang kidnaps the sheriff and two others and threatens to kill one per day until the man is freed.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: After Josh takes the task of finding a man and his wife's pet ewe, he becomes the butt of many jokes while cattlemen nearly hang him when he mentions sheep. His only clue is a gold bell the ewe wore.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.title: Jose Velasquez Hoozay: The Salvadoran
programme.desc: From his mom’s backyard to the big stage, Jose "Hoozay" Velasquez is taking the comedy world by storm with his heartwarming, hysterical storytelling.

programme.title: Bill Engvall: Here's Your Sign It's Finally Time My Last Show
programme.desc: After spending over four decades delighting audiences, the renowned comedian takes the stage for the last time in his farewell stand-up special.

programme.title: Andrew Dice Clay: One Night With Dice
programme.desc: A rare stand-up set and Q&A session with Andrew Dice Clay, performed at a Philly comedy club before he hit it big on the comedy and TV circuit.

programme.title: Bryan Callen: Man Class
programme.desc: In his first one-hour comedy special, the former MADtv comic gives his unique take on how to be a real man in our ever-changing modern society.

programme.title: Bryan Callen: Never Grow Up
programme.desc: The comedian examines the way our modern culture works, and wonders why we feel the need to view each other in such a narrow box.

programme.title: D.L. Hughley: Reset
programme.desc: Notable standup comedian D.L. Hughley skewers current political events, his own family issues, and more in this hilarious standup special.

programme.title: D.L. Hughley: Clear
programme.desc: Comedian D.L. Hughley comments on current political events and hot topics, from marijuana legalization to the advantages of intrusive white neighbors.

programme.title: Even More Funny Women of a Certain Age
programme.desc: Golden Globe winner Teri Hatcher joins the stage with some of the funniest women in comedy for one night of over-the-top, uninhibited standup.

programme.title: Gary Owen: Black Famous
programme.desc: This last year has been unlike any other: COVID, lockdowns, and for Gary, it has also included a divorce and family insanity unlike any other; up until now, Gary hasn't been able to speak about what really happened.

programme.title: Gary Owen: Breakin' Out the Park
programme.desc: In this brutally honest stand-up performance, comedian Gary Owen confesses his hilarious history of growing up in and around trailer parks.

programme.title: Gary Owen: #DoinWhatIDo
programme.desc: The so-called “Funniest Serviceman in America” draws from his multiracial experience to lambast culture wars on social media and in his own home.

programme.title: Lavell Crawford: The Comedy Vaccine (Extended Edition)
programme.desc: The Saul Goodman heavy takes his fifth stand-up special to Tempe, Arizona and he’s not holding back about anything—especially COVID-19.

programme.title: Kevin Hart Presents: Lil Rel Howery - RELevent
programme.desc: Hart hosts the high-energy comic who riffs on his upbringing, raising kids, and public transportation, proving he can be hilarious and relevant.

programme.title: Tiffany Haddish: She Ready! From the Hood to Hollywood!
programme.desc: The sensational “Girls Trip” star shares about her positive outlook on life, growing up in the foster care system, and working with legends.

programme.title: Gina Yashere: Skinny Bitch
programme.desc: Witty, razor-sharp observations abound in this stand-up performance from Gina Yashere. From bits about her mom and men, to colonic irrigation and luggage this special leaves no stone unturned.

programme.title: Gina Yashere: Laughing to America
programme.desc: Live from San Francisco, UK's top black female comedian Gina Yashere brings her unique insider-outsider perspective on America's hottest news.

programme.title: Lance Woods: Undeniable
programme.desc: Comedian Lance Woods brings his direct and unique takes on race relations, what he thinks about slave movies, and more on dating and modern life.

programme.title: Landry: Hair Chronicles
programme.desc: Curly-haired Canadian comedian Landry is here in a hilarious set about America’s eating habits and why Cracker Barrel lobbies look like yard sales.

programme.title: Jackie Fabulous: Menoplause
programme.desc: Life comes full circle for the native New Yorker who finds herself back in the Bronx to demonstrate how to navigate life’s biggest hurdles.

programme.title: Jasmine Ellis: Nobody's Queen
programme.desc: The newly married millennial discusses terrible insurance, her record as an employee, and a cartoon character she just doesn’t trust.

programme.title: Jasper Redd: Jazz Talk
programme.desc: Straight from the Folly Theater in Kansas City, polyrhythmic comedian, Jasper Redd breaks it down with a set that's sure to blow your top.

programme.title: Tommy Davidson: Takin' It To D.C.
programme.desc: Whether he's talking about sex, the national anthem, cockroaches or impersonating Michael Jackson, the triple threat is sure to make you laugh.

programme.title: Tommy Davidson: Illin' In Philly
programme.desc: This is Tommy Davidson, from "In Living Color", at his funniest! Check out this classic stand-up special and remember the 90s!

programme.title: Erik Terrell: Live at Helium Comedy Club
programme.desc: Named one of Variety magazine’s “Comics to Watch,” here’s Erik Terrell in a hilarious stand-up set delivered at his “home club” in Philly.

programme.title: Dino Archie: Toxic But Safe
programme.desc: Dino Archie's newest hour of comedy is the most beloved, toxic special of the year.

programme.title: Claudia Oshry: Disgraced Queen
programme.desc: As Instagram’s reigning disgraced queen, the comic takes on pop culture and all that is wrong with it, in an outrageous new stand-up comedy special.

programme.title: Del Harrison: From the Mouth of a Black Woman
programme.desc: In this comedy special, Del's impeccable storytelling transcends from her jokes to her original music as a live band and singers accompany her.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Arguing With Myself
programme.desc: Join Jeff and his outspoken felt pals: Walter, Peanut, José Jalapeño, Bubba J, and Sweet Daddy Dee for an evening of laughs and observations.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: I'm With Cupid
programme.desc: Ventriloquist and stand-up comedian Jeff Dunham performs an all-Valentine's Day-themed special.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Unhinged in Hollywood
programme.desc: Previously unseen stand-up comedy by Jeff Dunham; sketches that include popular characters; Brad Paisley performs; special appearances by comic Chris Parnell and former UFC champion Chuck Liddell.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Minding the Monsters
programme.desc: The comedian and ventriloquist extraordinaire, along with this felt friends, visits a haunted house where hilarious chaos ensues.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Spark of Insanity
programme.desc: Jeff and his felt friends Walter, Melvin the Superhero Guy, Peanut, and others share their latest and greatest thoughts about our times.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: All Over the Map
programme.desc: A comedy set and travelogue by comedian Jeff Dunham as he and his ventriloquist’s dummies perform globally from Iceland and London to Israel.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Controlled Chaos
programme.desc: The ventriloquist comedian provides fresh, hilarious material with his favorite puppets; Walter, Peanut, and two brand new characters.

programme.title: Jeff Allen: Honor Thy Wife
programme.desc: The laugh-out-loud funny stand up comedian focuses his special on the hilarious highs and relatable lows of everyday married life.

programme.title: Sinbad: Make Me Wanna Holla
programme.desc: A stand-up special covering the everything from the life advice his parents gave him to people with no talent having clothing lines and more.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty harvests his loofahs, plants tulip bulbs in pots, gives a masterclass in making leafmould and reflects on the gardening year.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Morocco, Monty discovers the wide variety of paradise gardens. He begins just outside the city of Marrakesh in an enormous royal walled meadow, The Agdal. From there he moves to the heart of the town where he comes upon a tiny garden where huge banana plants jostle with palms to create a secret paradise garden, a shelter from the busy world outside. And in another part of the city a rundown old palace has been turned into a stunning contemporary garden with a twist.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants a mix of white flowers in the writing garden, demonstrates how to prune a climbing rose and reviews what's been happening in the vegetable garden. Adam Frost celebrates seasonal colour on a visit to a garden in Essex, and Sue Kent pots up allium bulbs in readiness for spring and replants a tricky border with lavender she's grown from cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the Gardeners' World team look back at the horticultural highs of the latest series and celebrate the very best inspirational gardens and gardeners up and down the country.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the Gardeners' World team look back at the horticultural highlights from the latest series and celebrate the very best inspirational gardens and gardeners up and down the country.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's the Easter weekend, which means extra time to get out and enjoy the garden. At Longmeadow, Monty plants out sweet peas for summer colour, gives advice on what to use for mulching borders and has plenty of ideas for jobs to get on with this long weekend. Carol Klein is at RHS Rosemoor to revel in the floral spring sensations that epitomise the season. In Scotland, JJ Chalmers explains how important his local park was in helping both his physical and mental rehabilitation.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don prepares the flowering borders for winter and makes a bonfire, Carol celebrates our berry-laden hedgerows, and Rachel visits Julian Clary in his garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the team focus their attention on the loss of wildflower habitats in the UK and the part that gardeners can play in averting the resulting loss of wildlife. Adam Frost is in Lincolnshire to find out how crucial meadows are to supporting an ecosystem.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With autumn well and truly under way, Monty shares his tips on how to get more for your money when buying perennials. Planning ahead for a vibrant spring display, he also creates a bulb lasagne in a pot and harvests his pumpkins.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's apple harvest time, so Monty collects some of his windfalls to juice, plants a shrub in the Cottage Garden and pots up amaryllis bulbs for Christmas.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill is back at Powderham Castle in Devon, where she puts the finishing touches to a new herb bed. She prepares the vegetable beds for winter, planning for spring colour by planting tulip bulbs.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants a rose against a shady wall and checks on the progress of his supermarket garlic. Adam Frost visits a plantsman's paradise at Fullers Mill in Suffolk as the autumn colour emerges.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants a hawthorn hedge in the orchard, prunes a climbing rose and starts to plant tulips for next spring. He puts his dahlia tubers into storage and offers some timely advice for protecting plants over winter.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow Monty is planting bulbs in pots and around the garden for an explosion of spring colour. Carol Klein travels to Yorkshire where she takes a close look at the enormous colour range and form of a late season perennial, the salvia. Mark Lane is in Oxfordshire looking at how ornamental grasses can be used in planting design to create exciting combinations.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The programme comes from all four of the Royal Horticultural Society gardens, where the team are out on the road exploring how each location's differing climate affects the plants they grow. Carol Klein broadcasts from Wisley in Surrey. In the garden at Harlow Carr in Yorkshire, Joe Swift gets plenty of propagating tips. Rachel de Thame explores the gardens at Hyde Hall in Essex, and Monty Don visits Rosemoor in Devon.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill and the team continue to celebrate the joy that the gardening year brings; Rachel de Thame visits Anglesey Abbey; Arit Anderson discovers how rewilding can increase biodiversity.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels from the north west coast of Scotland to the north east coast of England, from historic reconstructions to modern re-inventions. He visits some of the most inhospitable places in the country and finds gardens that are flourishing.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across some of the country's landscapes, heading across the north of England to Northern Ireland. Here, Monty sees the ingenuity, passion and determination of British people to garden and create gardens, no matter what the canvas.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across the middle of the country, from Wales to Norfolk. He comes across gardens for gnomes, much-loved, well-tended allotments and extravagant gardens that bankrupted their owners.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the most densely populated part of the country, London and the home counties. He visits some of London's gardens, including a special one on a barge, as well as a beautifully restored garden close to where he grew up in Hampshire.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across the south west of the country to visit some of Britain's most exotic gardens. On this journey, Monty also goes to some of the country's most historic gardens, as well as some challenging contemporary ones.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across Central Spain. He begins at the vast, imposing palace and garden of the Escorial before heading for Madrid, Toledo, other parts of Castile and finally Valencia.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is in the south of Spain, visiting gardens that show how this part of the country has evolved thanks to influences from visitors and settlers from ancient to modern times.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels across northern Spain, visiting gardens across this vast and diverse landscape that changes from an Atlantic to a Mediterranean climate as he journeys from Galicia to Catalonia.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: One couple battle to turn a clay-clogged building site in Sussex into a piece of Portugal. Another tackle a forest of overgrowth in their new back garden in Cadeby. They are determined to create a productive space, something they have always wanted.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: A truck driver from Wakefield with a passion for flowers wants to create a perfect outside space for his girlfriend and burgeoning family, while in Swindon a widow wants to find the best way of turning her bleak patch of green into a cottage garden.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty travels to two corners of the country where the challenges he faces are very different. On the south coast he is presented with a front garden ravaged by salty winds, and in Snowdonia he helps a mountainside garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the days get shorter, it is a busy time in the garden. Monty Don cracks on with his seasonal tasks at Longmeadow, giving hints and tips along the way. Carol Klein visits first-time gardeners Dan and Dominique for the very last time.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the cottage garden, Monty is moving a rose which has outgrown its space and in the vegetable garden he gives advice on what to plant now for spring. He also finds out more about the mysterious world of earthworms and discovers why they are vital for the garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the last programme of the current series, Monty Don takes stock of his year at Longmeadow. We visit RHS Wisley to learn why autumn leaves are such a precious commodity for our gardens, and in the final instalment of her botany series, Carol Klein celebrates the glorious displays put on by flowering plants to attract pollinators.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With Bonfire Night in mind, Monty Don turns his attention to the firecracker colours of spring when he begins to tidy up his herbaceous plants to make room to plant tulip bulbs. As well as recommending varieties for an early display, he also shows what to plant now under the shade of trees for colour next year.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: The 2024 turkey season has arrived. Slade and Bentley are already off to a great start. Bentley managed to take one down opening weekend for youth hunt. And Slade took one down opening day. This episode features an inside look into Slade’s life filled with real eastate and the great outdoors.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: With Montana in the rearview mirror the Flylords team crosses over into Idaho. In this leg of the trip they hit Blue-Ribbon trout waters with the folks from Henrys Fork Anglers and Silver Creek Outfitters. They also have a chance to sit down with the owners of these operations and hear what these shops and fly fishing mean to them. Before they hit the road to Utah the crew joins in on another conservation event at Payette Brewing Company.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: It’s the final leg of the Fly Shop Tour and what better way to end it than with a trip down to see the crew at Fly Fish Food. We learn the unique story of how owners Clark “Cheech” Pierce & Curtis Fry started their shop and spend some time chasing hungry Cutthroat. Wrapping it all up the team puts on the final conservation event of the season with Fly Fish Food and Fish For Garbage, as well as spending some time behind the oars on the Green River with crew at Western Rivers Fly Shop.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: We kick off Season 2 in Tennessee where we stop in Nashville, Townsend, and Johnson City!!

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: This episode we make our way through the mountains of western North Carolina, where we stop in Asheville and Cashiers!!

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Another great hunt this week with Intrepid Care. We have the chance to hang out with some Veterans from all over the country. We gather to tell stories, build relationships, and just enjoy the great outdoors. This trip is action packed and the guys are chasing South Texas hogs from the ground.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: This is the story of how FE Hill ranch got it's start. From its inception, FE Hill has created opportunities for people to experience the outdoors and create memories. For us, it has created a tradition of Fathers and Sons hunting together.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We are blessed today to hunt with Cole Dutton for the Inaugural Pierce Dutton Memorial Hunt. We are honored to spend a weekend with Cole and his family at the G2 Ranch. Disabled Outdoorsman has played a huge part in getting those less fortunate outdoors. We are truly blessed to be able to follow along and capture these great moments.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Josh Kinser from Big and J introduced his daughters to hunting throughout South TX. With trips earlier in the year cancelled, Josh and Hattie were invited to join the TTHA crew at G2 ranch. The first night of the hunt proved to be a success for Hattie, wrapping a TX tag around her biggest buck. Josh and Hattie will have memories to last a lifetime after this hunt!

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We follow along with the crew from Struttinbuck on their annual Father Son hunt at FE Hill. No matter what happens throughout the year this is always a must have trip and a time to settle down and enjoy the great outdoors.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Over the years we have been able to hunt with a lot of amazing people. This episode takes us to Las Palmas ranch to hunt with Payton Angelle. Payton was awarded this hunt from the amazing people over at Sky High for kids.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We are blessed for the opportunity to follow along the guys from Trinity Oaks for Bucks for the Brave. The men and women that served in our armed services and as first responders, had jobs that required the, to be willing to sacrifice their own lives every day, in order to protect or save someone else's. Not many of us can say that, nor understand what that truly means. The things they've had to see, and the sacrifices they've made in their daily lives, can have a profound impact on them. Trinity Oaks' Bucks for the Brave platform allows the loved ones and communities that support these heroes to share their stories and unite us all in honoring and recognizing their service to our great nation. We are proud to continue to be a part of this incredible program, getting these heroes in the outdoors for the hunt of a lifetime.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: In 2010, Amberly Snyder’s life changed forever when an accident left her paralyzed from the waist-down. Her comeback story not unlike something you’d see in a movie…in fact it inspired one. Disabled Outdoorsmen USA contacted TTHA and set up this hunt and we were fortunate enough to be able to capture just some of Amberly’s story and her harvest of a beautiful Axis buck at the G2 Ranch in the spring of 2022.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Headed out of Crystal River once again, Capt. Blair & Capt. Mike Avinon of Circle Hook Fishing Charters head way out deep again for a few different species.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Throughout the season we get a lot of footage that never makes it on the show and isn't enough for a whole episode, so we put it together here in Bits & Bites.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Description Unavailable

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: The season finale, where we take a look at all the highlights of the season and some of our favorite moments.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green and Jeff Hutchinson set off to hunt the American Alligator in eastern Texas. A species that was placed on the endangered species list in the 1960s, their populations are now thriving. Kyle and Jeff have agreed to help remove some problem gators off private land owned by their friend Troy, but things get rowdy when Kyle loses a bet and has to swim with the very gators he is hunting.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: The Green Way Outdoors team heads to Alaska to target sockeye salmon. The beautiful color of these harvested fillets will blow your mind.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green and Jeff Hutchinson head to Maryland to bow-fish for an invasive, toothy fish called the snakehead. They learn how this fish, a native of Asia, made its way to the United States. They also learn from the locals, despite its appearance, it is one tasty fish.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green meets up with some friends at the Idaho Fish and Game Department to ice fish for cutthroat trout. Looking to test the results of previous restocking efforts, they'll be heading to some of the most remote lakes in the state only accessible by snowmobile.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Realtree Waterfowl crew heads to Arkansas to hunt mallards in the timber. Rusty Creasey hosts Tyler and Colton Jordan, and Cole Barthel for an epic duck hunt.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Black Cloud crew heads to the timber of Arkansas to hunt with good friends in an old blind that’s seen many unbelievable hunts throughout the years.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Realtree's Cole Barthel breaks down the key elements he uses to increase his odds in any duck hunt. From scouting to setup to safety, Cole has you covered.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Last season, Black Cloud joined W.E. Phillips at his Duck Club in the Arkansas Timber. W.E. Phillips was one of the original "Duck Men" in the classic Duck Commander Duck Men series with the Robertson family. On this hunt, W.E. tells stories of the old times and shares some CRAZY duck hunting strategies.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Rusty Creasey shares tips and tricks for calling ducks during the opening hunt of the second split of the Arkansas duck season.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: : Colder temps in the South bring two things: ducks and duck hunters. Dr. Duck and Billy Campbell are back in public timber, but so is the public. Will they get the hole? Will birds flare from sky busters? Find out on this week's episode.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Team Realtree continues to hunt the Arkansas timber working mallards and gadwall.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Realtree's crew of waterfowl hunters get together for their annual Louisiana duck hunt. Dr. Duck, Billy Campbell, Rusty Creasey, and Michael Pitts head down south to get on the ducks. There's a lot of ducks around, but they're playing hard to get. So, the guys have to get creative to make it happen.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin Leake joins some old friends on board the Fall Line in hopes of scoring big in the Bay Point Billfish Open. This trip will test the limits of all the anglers as the skilled captain and crew do the impossible in hopes of bringing home the prize.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin and Florida WaterSports pro Jeff Lange go deep off Panama City Beach to test the limits of a new battery powered reel. The results are surprising.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When tarpon don’t cooperate, it’s time for Capt. Justin and friend Ethan Register to have a competition for dinner options in the gulf’s grocery store.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: PCB’s white sand beaches are jam-packed with visitors soaking up sunand surf while Justin and Meredith chase schools of migrating tarponjust offshore. How often do those two worlds collide?

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: With human populations scattered through the landscape, human-wildlife conflict is a common occurrence in Borneo. Dan Cabela travels to the area to participate in an ambitious elephant collaring project, hoping to better understand how people and elephants can live harmoniously.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: A remnant of the last Ice Age, the musk ox is almost mythical in appearance. For the people who share the Barren Ground region of Canada with them, they are an integral part of their culture. Show host, Dan Cabela, participates in a scientific sampling project to monitor the population's health, and get first-hand experience of the relationship between local people and this arctic icon.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Establishing themselves just after the last Ice Age, the blacktail of Vancouver Island offers an important genetic population isolated from the mainland. To explore the local relationship with the species, its harvesting, conservation and history, Dan Cabela travels to the island.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Dan Cabela sets out to learn about the model of private ownership of wildlife in South Africa. Along the way, he participates in game capture, attends an auction and hunts to support a community.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: It’s opening day of grouper season and, for Capt. Justin Leake and one of his longtime fishing buddies, that means a trip offshore is in order. And what better way to break in a new boat than heading to some reefs and filling the cooler with one of the Gulf of Mexico’s most popular fish?

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: There’s nothing like a change in weather conditions to wreck a perfectly good fishing plan, and that’s exactly what Capt. Justin Leake and his cousin encounter when December turns unseasonably warm. It’s a grey morning with thick fog so Justin and Capt. Brent Berry won’t be heading offshore right away as planned. Instead, Justin turns to his Humminbird CoastMaster charts to pinpoint a near shore artificial reef just five minutes from the St. Andrews Pass, where the anglers will do a little fishing until the fog burns off. Capt. Leake opts to send a jig to the bottom and he’s not very picky about the one that gets tied on. “When fishing reefs, the specific jig doesn’t matter because it’s all about the presentation,” he says. “When you’re sitting on top of a wreck, break out the ‘junk jigs’ – they get bit just fine.” And that proves to be the case as Justin and Brent enjoy non-stop battles against amberjack, red snapper and bonita. And with a bite this good, there’s no reason to go anywhere else! Also, we take a look at the United States Coast Guard Auxiliary’s new paddle craft safety initiative.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor use Lowrance Active Target all day to find fish, first targeting bridge tarpon then finding a variety of species in Florida Bay mullet muds.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor chase Tarpon of all sizes around Florida Bay and the Everglades.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor catch spotted sea trout and jacks on the grass flats and potholes in Florida Bay.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor head to the iconic Seven Mile Bridge targeting big jack crevasses and permit.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor head offshore to the Marathon Hump, taking advantage of the 26-feet hybrid boat's versatility to find some exciting Blackfin and Skipjack Tuna fishing.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by scientist Nick Haddad, who educates our hosts and the fishing world on the various descending devices used to preserve stressed catch from deeper waters as the three of them get into some fun Red Snapper fishing off the coast of Marathon, Florida in the Keys.

programme.title: Sportsmans Journal
programme.desc: Staying mobile and drilling lots of holes while chasing roaming bluegills on the ice is the name of the game. Using larger baits like spoons also separates the littles from the Bulls!

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: Breaking down Lake of the Woods can be tough when in search for big walleyes. But Tyler and Sara may have found a new favorite jig to get the job done!

programme.title: LBP Spotlight
programme.desc: LBP Spotlights Internet Personality and YouTube Star Lawson Lindsey as he searches for trophy fish at the Headwaters of the Loxahatchee River.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade and his son take on the turkey woods for an afternoon hunt. Although the woods remained quiet, a tom soon snuck out of the woods and on the end of Bentley's barrel! After that Slade was able to help a client of his harvest his first turkey! And boy was it an action packed hunt! Jakes, hens, and tons of gobbles, This hunt is spectacular! Lastly, Slade introduces a property that we have already made a video on, but with just how amazing the land is, we had to include it! Floweree is the epitome of a sportsman's paradise!

programme.title: LBP Spotlight
programme.desc: Meet Ryan, a seasoned St. Petersburg guide, fighting tides, time, and the last great tarpon run of the season.

programme.title: LBP Spotlight
programme.desc: Meet Captain Lionel James — a respected Destin, Florida guide known for his upbeat personality, strong community ties, and love for fitness when he’s not on the water.

programme.title: LBP Spotlight
programme.desc: He’s the original fishing coach. From the helm of one of the most iconic inshore shows ever made, Captain C.A. Richardson has taught a generation how to fish. This documentary dives into his story. The man, the mission, and the waters that made him who he is.

programme.title: LBP Spotlight
programme.desc: LBP Spotlights Internet Personality and YouTube Star Lawson Lindsey as he searches for trophy fish at the Headwaters of the Loxahatchee River.

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: C.A. joins Rhett Morris in Charlotte Harbor for an inshore slam adventure in one of Florida’s most productive estuaries.

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: CA and Marlin head to the beautiful waters of Tarpon Springs for cobia and trout.

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: CA and Trevor field test some new Flats Class Exclusive Rods.

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: CA heads to the northern regions of the Nature Coast for a multi-species day.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: With the drought ending and rain headed their way, the crew hunts the final days of the first split in Bayou Black with new friends Jesse Griffiths and Dirk Sorrells.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: The second split is here, and the crew decides to try their luck at historic Old Hickory in Lacour, Louisiana. Ducks, deer, and mouth-watering meals are all on the menu.

programme.title: Saltwater Underground
programme.desc: Nick joins Capt. Dave DeGenarro as lightning quick bonito invade New Jersey waters for fast-paced, reel-burning action on light tackle.

programme.title: Saltwater Underground
programme.desc: Nick visits the Crystal Coast of North Carolina to search out redfish and seatrout in the backwaters with Capt. Joe Tunstall and Capt. Chris Kimney.

programme.title: Saltwater Underground
programme.desc: Ike on Stripers Bassmaster legend Mike Iaconelli joins Nick in a wild time chasing down striped bass blitzes off the Jersey Coast, getting bent rods from the boat and surf.

programme.title: Saltwater Underground
programme.desc: Trophy Tautog are on the hit list for Nick and his crew as they ply the wrecks and reefs off New Jersey.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin Leake joins some old friends on board the Fall Line in hopes of scoring big in the Bay Point Billfish Open. This trip will test the limits of all the anglers as the skilled captain and crew do the impossible in hopes of bringing home the prize.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin and Florida WaterSports pro Jeff Lange go deep off Panama City Beach to test the limits of a new battery powered reel. The results are surprising.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When tarpon don’t cooperate, it’s time for Capt. Justin and friend Ethan Register to have a competition for dinner options in the gulf’s grocery store.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: PCB’s white sand beaches are jam-packed with visitors soaking up sunand surf while Justin and Meredith chase schools of migrating tarponjust offshore. How often do those two worlds collide?

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Join Mark Peterson as he heads to Kentucky for the late muzzleloader season. Already having an unforgettable season so far after taking “Freak Show” back in early September, he is looking to cap off his Kentucky season with a great buck with his Muzzleloader.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson continues his hunt in Mexico for a Mexican Texanus Whitetail. On day one, Mark connected with a great management buck, making this buck the first Mexican Texanus Whitetail with his rifle. As temperatures drop and bucks become more active each passing day, he eagerly anticipates an action-packed evening ahead.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson continues his journey toward the North America Deer Slam — this time deep in the rugged mountains of North Central Mexico. In pursuit of one of the smallest and rarest Whitetail subspecies, the elusive Mexican Central Plateau Whitetail, Mark faces harsh terrain, high elevations, and the challenge of locating a deer that few hunters have ever seen, let alone taken.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson and Earl Peterson are headed down to Kentucky for the opening of deer season. With this being the earliest that a bowhunter can hunt whitetails, it can result in a giant velvet whitetail harvest. After a fun night enjoying the Swon Brothers' music, it's time to dial the bow in, freshen up the Buck Bourbon at feed sites and hope that Brows or Kevins' buck show themselves. How will the story end on the Giant Deer named Brows?

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: About 2-3 months ago Mark purchased a 300+ acre farm in Kentucky. After running trail cameras and putting food plots on the farm, Mark now has the chance to get in the stand on opening day of Kentucky's bow season. There have been plenty of shooter bucks on the farm but only a few still are holding their velvet. Mark has his sights set on a Giant Kentucky Velvet Whitetail. The day before opening day Salt River puts on a celebration that features the @theswonbrothers.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Ismael Garcia was just a young soldier when a tragic incident in Afghanistan changed his life forever. He was left wounded and scarred, but the hardest part came after he returned home. Hunting had always been his escape. But after war, everything felt different — until he picked up a bow.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Will Cooper finally trades 3 years of tough times for triumph in his quest to tag an out-of-state buck with a bow.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Josh Dahlke grabs a TenPoint crossbow and kicks back on "Island Time," along with the Nashville rockers from Loose Lips.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Join Will Cooper on an unforgettable adventure in the Colorado mountains, where he dedicated three years chasing elusive bull elk without success. Determined to turn the tide, Will enlists the expertise of his good friend Jermaine Hodge, prior World Elk Calling Champion and Wrestling Coach for the United States Army World Class Athlete Program. Together, they face challenges and overcome adversity during a thrilling public land over-the-counter rifle hunt. Experience the highs and lows of their journey against the stunning backdrop of Colorado's wilderness.

programme.title: Sportsmans Journal
programme.desc: Staying mobile and drilling lots of holes while chasing roaming bluegills on the ice is the name of the game. Using larger baits like spoons also separates the littles from the Bulls!

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: Breaking down Lake of the Woods can be tough when in search for big walleyes. But Tyler and Sara may have found a new favorite jig to get the job done!

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott Walker and Steve Rodger take Plantation Boat Mart’s new 36’ Invincible out to the swordfish grounds.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott Walker and Steve Rodger break in their new Invincible Catamaran with a trip to fish out of Palm Beach with their friend Captain Dave Fields.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott Walker and Steve Rodger fly kites with Captain Dave Fields for a great day of sailfishing out of Sailfish Marina in Palm Beach.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott Walker and Steve Rodger take a long run out into the Gulf from Key West to sample the bottom fishing and the long range capability of their new Invincible Catamaran.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott Walker and Steve Rodger continue fishing after taking a long run out into the Gulf from Key West to sample the bottom fishing and the long range capability of their new Invincible Catamaran.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott Walker and Steve Rodger fish out of Key West for tunas and sailfish while battling big seas and big sharks.

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: In Episode 10 Boat Trader heads to central Texas to explore boating culture in the lone star state. Second only to Alaska in size, Texas is known as the place where everything is bigger. From big college football games to endless oil fields and vast wind farms, Texas is home to more than 30 million Americans. But the state is about more than just big oil, college football and cattle farms - it's also home to some of the best boating in the country. Boasting a myriad of waterways, boaters here enjoy hundreds of lakes, rivers and streams that provide recreational opportunities, abundant wildlife and plenty of fishing. From Austin Texas to San Antonio host Ryan McVinney and the Boat Trader crew explore the laid-back Texas lake life including boat up restaurants along the Colorado River, watersports in Austin and the history of the waterways throughout the region. Boat manufacturers highlighted in this episode are Tige Boats and ATX Surf Boats, two premium Texas-based wake boat brands known for their high-quality, cutting-edge vessels that come equipped with advanced wake shaping technologies and equipment ideal for water skiing, wake surfing and wakeboarding. There's even a wake surfing dog!

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Mitch Widom, Andy Yaffa, & Chris Hammaway join Capt. Jared Raskob in Los Cabos on the hunt for Striped Marlin Part 1.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: The 2024 turkey season has arrived. Slade and Bentley are already off to a great start. Bentley managed to take one down opening weekend for youth hunt. And Slade took one down opening day. This episode features an inside look into Slade’s life filled with real eastate and the great outdoors.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: With Montana in the rearview mirror the Flylords team crosses over into Idaho. In this leg of the trip they hit Blue-Ribbon trout waters with the folks from Henrys Fork Anglers and Silver Creek Outfitters. They also have a chance to sit down with the owners of these operations and hear what these shops and fly fishing mean to them. Before they hit the road to Utah the crew joins in on another conservation event at Payette Brewing Company.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: It’s the final leg of the Fly Shop Tour and what better way to end it than with a trip down to see the crew at Fly Fish Food. We learn the unique story of how owners Clark “Cheech” Pierce & Curtis Fry started their shop and spend some time chasing hungry Cutthroat. Wrapping it all up the team puts on the final conservation event of the season with Fly Fish Food and Fish For Garbage, as well as spending some time behind the oars on the Green River with crew at Western Rivers Fly Shop.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: We kick off Season 2 in Tennessee where we stop in Nashville, Townsend, and Johnson City!!

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: This episode we make our way through the mountains of western North Carolina, where we stop in Asheville and Cashiers!!

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Another great hunt this week with Intrepid Care. We have the chance to hang out with some Veterans from all over the country. We gather to tell stories, build relationships, and just enjoy the great outdoors. This trip is action packed and the guys are chasing South Texas hogs from the ground.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: This is the story of how FE Hill ranch got it's start. From its inception, FE Hill has created opportunities for people to experience the outdoors and create memories. For us, it has created a tradition of Fathers and Sons hunting together.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We are blessed today to hunt with Cole Dutton for the Inaugural Pierce Dutton Memorial Hunt. We are honored to spend a weekend with Cole and his family at the G2 Ranch. Disabled Outdoorsman has played a huge part in getting those less fortunate outdoors. We are truly blessed to be able to follow along and capture these great moments.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Josh Kinser from Big and J introduced his daughters to hunting throughout South TX. With trips earlier in the year cancelled, Josh and Hattie were invited to join the TTHA crew at G2 ranch. The first night of the hunt proved to be a success for Hattie, wrapping a TX tag around her biggest buck. Josh and Hattie will have memories to last a lifetime after this hunt!

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We follow along with the crew from Struttinbuck on their annual Father Son hunt at FE Hill. No matter what happens throughout the year this is always a must have trip and a time to settle down and enjoy the great outdoors.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Over the years we have been able to hunt with a lot of amazing people. This episode takes us to Las Palmas ranch to hunt with Payton Angelle. Payton was awarded this hunt from the amazing people over at Sky High for kids.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We are blessed for the opportunity to follow along the guys from Trinity Oaks for Bucks for the Brave. The men and women that served in our armed services and as first responders, had jobs that required the, to be willing to sacrifice their own lives every day, in order to protect or save someone else's. Not many of us can say that, nor understand what that truly means. The things they've had to see, and the sacrifices they've made in their daily lives, can have a profound impact on them. Trinity Oaks' Bucks for the Brave platform allows the loved ones and communities that support these heroes to share their stories and unite us all in honoring and recognizing their service to our great nation. We are proud to continue to be a part of this incredible program, getting these heroes in the outdoors for the hunt of a lifetime.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: In 2010, Amberly Snyder’s life changed forever when an accident left her paralyzed from the waist-down. Her comeback story not unlike something you’d see in a movie…in fact it inspired one. Disabled Outdoorsmen USA contacted TTHA and set up this hunt and we were fortunate enough to be able to capture just some of Amberly’s story and her harvest of a beautiful Axis buck at the G2 Ranch in the spring of 2022.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Headed out of Crystal River once again, Capt. Blair & Capt. Mike Avinon of Circle Hook Fishing Charters head way out deep again for a few different species.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Throughout the season we get a lot of footage that never makes it on the show and isn't enough for a whole episode, so we put it together here in Bits & Bites.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Description Unavailable

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: The season finale, where we take a look at all the highlights of the season and some of our favorite moments.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green and Jeff Hutchinson set off to hunt the American Alligator in eastern Texas. A species that was placed on the endangered species list in the 1960s, their populations are now thriving. Kyle and Jeff have agreed to help remove some problem gators off private land owned by their friend Troy, but things get rowdy when Kyle loses a bet and has to swim with the very gators he is hunting.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: The Green Way Outdoors team heads to Alaska to target sockeye salmon. The beautiful color of these harvested fillets will blow your mind.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green and Jeff Hutchinson head to Maryland to bow-fish for an invasive, toothy fish called the snakehead. They learn how this fish, a native of Asia, made its way to the United States. They also learn from the locals, despite its appearance, it is one tasty fish.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green meets up with some friends at the Idaho Fish and Game Department to ice fish for cutthroat trout. Looking to test the results of previous restocking efforts, they'll be heading to some of the most remote lakes in the state only accessible by snowmobile.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Realtree Waterfowl crew heads to Arkansas to hunt mallards in the timber. Rusty Creasey hosts Tyler and Colton Jordan, and Cole Barthel for an epic duck hunt.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Black Cloud crew heads to the timber of Arkansas to hunt with good friends in an old blind that’s seen many unbelievable hunts throughout the years.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Realtree's Cole Barthel breaks down the key elements he uses to increase his odds in any duck hunt. From scouting to setup to safety, Cole has you covered.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Last season, Black Cloud joined W.E. Phillips at his Duck Club in the Arkansas Timber. W.E. Phillips was one of the original "Duck Men" in the classic Duck Commander Duck Men series with the Robertson family. On this hunt, W.E. tells stories of the old times and shares some CRAZY duck hunting strategies.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Rusty Creasey shares tips and tricks for calling ducks during the opening hunt of the second split of the Arkansas duck season.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: : Colder temps in the South bring two things: ducks and duck hunters. Dr. Duck and Billy Campbell are back in public timber, but so is the public. Will they get the hole? Will birds flare from sky busters? Find out on this week's episode.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Team Realtree continues to hunt the Arkansas timber working mallards and gadwall.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Realtree's crew of waterfowl hunters get together for their annual Louisiana duck hunt. Dr. Duck, Billy Campbell, Rusty Creasey, and Michael Pitts head down south to get on the ducks. There's a lot of ducks around, but they're playing hard to get. So, the guys have to get creative to make it happen.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin Leake joins some old friends on board the Fall Line in hopes of scoring big in the Bay Point Billfish Open. This trip will test the limits of all the anglers as the skilled captain and crew do the impossible in hopes of bringing home the prize.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin and Florida WaterSports pro Jeff Lange go deep off Panama City Beach to test the limits of a new battery powered reel. The results are surprising.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When tarpon don’t cooperate, it’s time for Capt. Justin and friend Ethan Register to have a competition for dinner options in the gulf’s grocery store.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: PCB’s white sand beaches are jam-packed with visitors soaking up sunand surf while Justin and Meredith chase schools of migrating tarponjust offshore. How often do those two worlds collide?

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: With human populations scattered through the landscape, human-wildlife conflict is a common occurrence in Borneo. Dan Cabela travels to the area to participate in an ambitious elephant collaring project, hoping to better understand how people and elephants can live harmoniously.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: A remnant of the last Ice Age, the musk ox is almost mythical in appearance. For the people who share the Barren Ground region of Canada with them, they are an integral part of their culture. Show host, Dan Cabela, participates in a scientific sampling project to monitor the population's health, and get first-hand experience of the relationship between local people and this arctic icon.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Establishing themselves just after the last Ice Age, the blacktail of Vancouver Island offers an important genetic population isolated from the mainland. To explore the local relationship with the species, its harvesting, conservation and history, Dan Cabela travels to the island.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Dan Cabela sets out to learn about the model of private ownership of wildlife in South Africa. Along the way, he participates in game capture, attends an auction and hunts to support a community.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: It’s opening day of grouper season and, for Capt. Justin Leake and one of his longtime fishing buddies, that means a trip offshore is in order. And what better way to break in a new boat than heading to some reefs and filling the cooler with one of the Gulf of Mexico’s most popular fish?

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: There’s nothing like a change in weather conditions to wreck a perfectly good fishing plan, and that’s exactly what Capt. Justin Leake and his cousin encounter when December turns unseasonably warm. It’s a grey morning with thick fog so Justin and Capt. Brent Berry won’t be heading offshore right away as planned. Instead, Justin turns to his Humminbird CoastMaster charts to pinpoint a near shore artificial reef just five minutes from the St. Andrews Pass, where the anglers will do a little fishing until the fog burns off. Capt. Leake opts to send a jig to the bottom and he’s not very picky about the one that gets tied on. “When fishing reefs, the specific jig doesn’t matter because it’s all about the presentation,” he says. “When you’re sitting on top of a wreck, break out the ‘junk jigs’ – they get bit just fine.” And that proves to be the case as Justin and Brent enjoy non-stop battles against amberjack, red snapper and bonita. And with a bite this good, there’s no reason to go anywhere else! Also, we take a look at the United States Coast Guard Auxiliary’s new paddle craft safety initiative.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor use Lowrance Active Target all day to find fish, first targeting bridge tarpon then finding a variety of species in Florida Bay mullet muds.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor chase Tarpon of all sizes around Florida Bay and the Everglades.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor catch spotted sea trout and jacks on the grass flats and potholes in Florida Bay.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor head to the iconic Seven Mile Bridge targeting big jack crevasses and permit.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor head offshore to the Marathon Hump, taking advantage of the 26-feet hybrid boat's versatility to find some exciting Blackfin and Skipjack Tuna fishing.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by scientist Nick Haddad, who educates our hosts and the fishing world on the various descending devices used to preserve stressed catch from deeper waters as the three of them get into some fun Red Snapper fishing off the coast of Marathon, Florida in the Keys.

programme.desc: Staying mobile and drilling lots of holes while chasing roaming bluegills on the ice is the name of the game. Using larger baits like spoons also separates the littles from the Bulls!

programme.title: LBP Spotlight
programme.desc: LBP Spotlights Internet Personality and YouTube Star Lawson Lindsey as he searches for trophy fish at the Headwaters of the Loxahatchee River.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade and his son take on the turkey woods for an afternoon hunt. Although the woods remained quiet, a tom soon snuck out of the woods and on the end of Bentley's barrel! After that Slade was able to help a client of his harvest his first turkey! And boy was it an action packed hunt! Jakes, hens, and tons of gobbles, This hunt is spectacular! Lastly, Slade introduces a property that we have already made a video on, but with just how amazing the land is, we had to include it! Floweree is the epitome of a sportsman's paradise!

programme.title: LBP Spotlight
programme.desc: Meet Ryan, a seasoned St. Petersburg guide, fighting tides, time, and the last great tarpon run of the season.

programme.title: LBP Spotlight
programme.desc: Meet Captain Lionel James — a respected Destin, Florida guide known for his upbeat personality, strong community ties, and love for fitness when he’s not on the water.

programme.title: LBP Spotlight
programme.desc: He’s the original fishing coach. From the helm of one of the most iconic inshore shows ever made, Captain C.A. Richardson has taught a generation how to fish. This documentary dives into his story. The man, the mission, and the waters that made him who he is.

programme.title: LBP Spotlight

programme.desc: C.A. joins Rhett Morris in Charlotte Harbor for an inshore slam adventure in one of Florida’s most productive estuaries.

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: CA and Marlin head to the beautiful waters of Tarpon Springs for cobia and trout.

Second only to Alaska in size, Texas is known as the place where everything is bigger. From big college football games to endless oil fields and vast wind farms, Texas is home to more than 30 million Americans. But the state is about more than just big oil, college football and cattle farms - it's also home to some of the best boating in the country. Boasting a myriad of waterways, boaters here enjoy hundreds of lakes, rivers and streams that provide recreational opportunities, abundant wildlife and plenty of fishing. From Austin Texas to San Antonio host Ryan McVinney and the Boat Trader crew explore the laid-back Texas lake life including boat up restaurants along the Colorado River, watersports in Austin and the history of the waterways throughout the region. Boat manufacturers highlighted in this episode are Tige Boats and ATX Surf Boats, two premium Texas-based wake boat brands known for their high-quality, cutting-edge vessels that come equipped with advanced wake shaping technologies and equipment ideal for water skiing, wake surfing and wakeboarding. There's even a wake surfing dog!
